linefit

Class GraphOptionsFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • linefit.GraphOptionsFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GraphOptionsFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class handles the creation and the display of the graph options menu
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GraphOptionsFrame.GraphOptionsFrameLayout
      A Layout class that positions all the buttons and options in the frame
      private class  GraphOptionsFrame.GraphOptionsListener
      A generic listener class that picks up any button or checkbox event and handles it properly, either saving and closing or disable or enabling options and fields that are no longer applicable with the selected options
      private class  GraphOptionsFrame.MyFocusTraversalPolicy
      A listener that is called when the user hits the tabs key that sets the order through which the options in the options menu are focused in
      private class  GraphOptionsFrame.OnlyAllowNumbersListener
      A private Listener class that implements FocusListener so that we can save the value when the field is first focused on so that we can return it to the field's preselected value if the input was not a valid number String.

    • Field Detail

      • inputFieldValueOnFocused

        java.lang.String inputFieldValueOnFocused
        This String keeps track of what value was in the currently selected field at the moment it was first selected. This lets us revert the field to its previous value if an invalid number string is inputed. This is only used for places where only numbers are allowed

      • serialVersionUID

      • doesFieldContainValidDoubleString

        public boolean doesFieldContainValidDoubleString(javax.swing.JTextField fieldToCheckForNumber)
        Checks the String value in the given field to see if it contains a valid double as a String
        Parameters:
        fieldToCheckForNumber - The text field that will be checked to see whether or not it contains a double number as a String
        Returns:
        A boolean of whether or not the passed TextField has a valid double as a String in it

      • updateGraphOptionsEnabledStatuses

        public void updateGraphOptionsEnabledStatuses()
        This function is called when a checkbox has been toggled in the Graph Options menu and updates each block on the options to disable and enable parts that are relevant or not now that the option has been selected or deselcted
